snippet: Flat consumer spending and a decrease in manufacturing overshadowed February’s increase in retail and auto sales, and positive news on jobless claims.
abstract: Commerce Department says inflation and taxes reduced income gains in January, and inflation-adjusted spending was unchanged for the third consecutive month; Institute for Supply Management's national factory index fell 52.4 in February, indicating a slower rate of expansion; Commerce Dept says total construction spending at seasonally-adjusted annual rate fell 0.1 percent in January; Labor Dept says initial unemployment claims fell in mid-February to lowest level since August 2008.
lead_paragraph: Flat consumer spending and a decrease in manufacturing overshadowed February’s increase in retail and auto sales, and positive news on jobless claims.

headline.seo: Economic Data Shows Signs of a Slowdown
headline.main: Spending and Factory Reports Indicate a Slowdown
headline.print_headline: Spending and Factory Reports Indicate a Slowdown
